sentences.en: Barry had his nose put out of joint by Lucy's aloof sophistication.
sentences.cn: 露西的冷淡与世故使得巴里十分不快。

sentences.en: He claimed that the businessman had conned him of £10,000.
sentences.cn: 他声称那个商人骗了他1万英镑。

sentences.en: He had a reputation for being bloody-minded and difficult.
sentences.cn: 他为人刻薄、难相处是出了名的。

sentences.en: His house was the only settled home I had as a child.
sentences.cn: 他的房子是我儿时唯一固定的家。

sentences.en: I had obtained the authentic details about the birth of the organization.
sentences.cn: 我已经掌握了有关该组织诞生的可靠的详细资料。

sentences.en: I try to remember all the good times I've had here.
sentences.cn: 我试着回忆在这里度过的所有美好时光。

sentences.en: Kaspar had spoken know-ledgeably about the state of agriculture in Europe.
sentences.cn: 卡斯帕对欧洲农业状况发表了一番颇有见地的见解。

sentences.en: The airline had losses of $35m and was bailed out by Qantas.
sentences.cn: 这家航空公司亏损达3,500万美元，而澳航出资帮助其摆脱了困境。

sentences.en: The commander and some of the men had been released.
sentences.cn: 指挥官和一些士兵已经获释。

sentences.en: The house seemed muted, hushed as if it had been deserted.
sentences.cn: 房子里似乎悄然无声，安静得好像已经没人在住一样。

sentences.en: The jury found that the NFL had violated antitrust laws.
sentences.cn: 陪审团裁决全国橄榄球联盟触犯了反垄断法。

sentences.en: The opportunity had gone. His mind scrabbled for alternatives.
sentences.cn: 机会已经失去。他苦苦思索别的方案。

sentences.en: The public never had faith in his ability to handle the job.
sentences.cn: 公众从来不相信他有能力胜任这一职位。

sentences.en: The recent rain had churned up the waterfall into a muddy whirlpool.
sentences.cn: 最近的一场雨把瀑布搅成了泥水漩涡。

sentences.en: When she had attempted to cut his nails he resisted.
sentences.cn: 她试图给他剪指甲，他不让。

trans.tran_cn: 得病（例如 had a cold 得了感冒）
有（ have的过去式和过去分词 ），（亲属关系中）接受，拿，买到
